name: Moroccan Lentil Stew
author: Kim's Cooking Now
summary: This hearty stew is loaded with vegetables, so it's easy on the waistline! I recently re-joined WW, and am searching for ways to incorporate more legumes and veggies in my diet, and this recipe makes that easy. The warm Moroccan spices ensure a flavorful stew. One serving is 4sp on the WW green plan.
ingredients: 2 cubes  tomato bouillon with chicken flavoring (such as Knorr®)
1 cup peeled and chopped butternut squash
½ cup chopped fresh green beans
directions: Stir hot water and tomato bouillon together in a bowl until dissolved
Heat oil over medium heat in a Dutch oven or large pot
Add onion; cook and stir until starting to soften, about 3 minutes
Stir in garlic, fenugreek leaves, bay leaf, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, salt, and cayenne pepper; cook for 1 minute more
Stir in lentils, butternut squash, carrot, celery, and tomato bouillon
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until lentils have softened, about 45 minutes
Add green beans and peas and cook for 5 minutes more
